Description.val:
ASSAULT BREACHER VEHICLE (ABV) is a tracked, armored combat engineer vehicle designed to breach minefields and complex obstacles and provide a deliberate and in-stride breaching capability. ABV consists of a rebuilt and upgraded M1A1 Tank chassis with the integration of Non-Developmental Items (NDI), which includes a Full-Width Mine Plow, a Dozer Blade, a Surface Mine Plow, a Rapid Ordnance Removal System, two M58 Linear Demolition Charges, a lane marking system and a self-defense weapon system. The ABV will provide crew protection and vehicle survivability while having the speed and mobility to keep pace with the maneuver force. The M1A1 Tank Chassis will provide economic supportability of the system through its commonality with the tank fleet and armor protection for survivability.

MK 154 MODERNIZATION is a line charge launcher system installed in the Amphibious Assault Vehicle Personnel variant (AAVP7) used to breach mine fields in shallow water and inland areas, providing the USMC with an amphibious operations breaching capability.

FAMILY OF EOD EQUIPMENT (FEOD) is comprised of over forty Table of Authorized Material Control Numbers (TAMCNs)  providing the required tools and capabilities to detect, locate, access, identify, triage, diagnose, stabilize, render safe, neutralize, recover, exploit, and dispose of unexploded explosive ordnance (UXO), improvised explosive devices (IED), and weapons of mass destruction (WMD).  The portfolio includes specialized diagnostic equipment, robotics and energetically actuated tools, which enable EOD to provide the Marine air-ground task force (MAGTF) and Marine Special Operations Forces with critical enabling capabilities that deliver responsive, scalable, strategic depth for special operations, crisis response, and littoral access.

MINE RESISTANT AMBUSH PROTECTED (MRAP) Family of Vehicles (FoV) provides Warfighters multi-mission platforms capable of mitigating Improvised Explosive Devices (IEDs), underbody mines, and small arms fire threats, which are currently the greatest casualty producers in Overseas Contingency Operations (OCO). Multiple MRAP vehicle categories (CATs) have been procured, fielded, and sustained: MRAP-All Terrain Vehicle (M-ATV) - Combat operations (ops) in rural, mountainous, urban terrain.  Category I - Urban combat operations, ambulance. Category II - Multi-mission ops-convoy lead, troop transport, ambulance, utility vehicle. Category III - Mine/IED clearance ops, explosive ordnance disposal. Funding includes required Government Furnished Equipment (GFE)/subsystems and Engineering Change Proposal (ECP)/Capability Insertion in response to an UUNS and Warfighter safety and survivability requirements.

MRAP funding has been realigned to BLI 5050 beginning in FY19.

MARINE ELECTRONIC WARFARE GROUND FAMILY OF SYSTEMS (MEGFoS) provides interconnected electronic warfare systems for use at fixed sites, on tactical vehicles, and dismounted that will operate across a range of frequencies in order to provide the Marine Corps that ability to maneuver efficiently inside the electromagnetic spectrum.  MEGFOS provides the ability to protect friendly use of spectrum, sense all spectrum usage in an area of responsibility, and to target adversaries inside spectrum with the intent to deny, delay or degrade an adversary's decision making cycle.  MEGFOS also includes the ability to use spectrum for force protection to counter Radio Controlled Improvised Explosive Devices (RCIED) and Unmanned Aerial Systems.  MEGFOS is the follow on capability to MFEW and will begin developmental efforts in FY20 with production efforts beginning FY23. 

FAMILY OF COUNTER-IMPROVISED EXPLOSIVE DEVICE (C-IED) CAPABILITIES (F2C) provides capabilities not found in the current Joint land force structure to defeat explosive hazards and protect Marines and equipment while conducting route and area clearance operations. The Family of Counter-Improvised Explosive Device (C-IED) Capabilities (F2C) will enable Commanders to deliberately operate in explosive hazards environments by detecting and marking explosive hazards, enabling the Commanders to make timely and informed decisions to avoid the explosive hazards, or, if necessary, neutralize explosive hazards that impede their missions. Multiple detection and marking capabilities will detect a broader spectrum of explosive hazards and achieve higher overall effectiveness rates. Standoff and remote-controlled detection and marking capabilities will remove Joint forces from direct contact with explosive hazards and enhance force protection and the vehicles' system survivability. Operational speeds and rates will increase and better support the operational tempo (OPTEMPO) of the current and future force. ENFIRE is a digital surveying kit designed to collect and disseminate engineer-related information while minimizing exposure to enemy observation.

Justification.val:
FY 2018 Base Appropriation Request: $26.670M

MINE RESISTANT AMBUSH PROTECTED (MRAP) VEHICLES: ($1.389M) Funded Engineering Change Proposal (ECP) upgrades for the enduring MRAP vehicle requirement.  Funded both the Blue Force Tracker and JBC-P A-kit development and procurement to maintain vehicle relevancy in meeting force protection threats and responding to operational needs.  Beginning in FY19, MRAP funding has been realigned from BLI 6520 to BLI 5050.  Realignment of efforts to new BLI in FY19 and beyond reflects USMC Program Management Office (PMO) reorganization to improve support of USMC OPFOR. 

FAMILY OF EOD EQUIPMENT: ($25.281M) Funded Supply Stock Lists (SL-3) Kits.  SL-3 are the tools, parts and specialized tools that come with the primary system. The procurement supported the following items:  Demolition Firing Device Kits (DFDK). DFDK is comprised of COTS items that provided EOD technicians with the capability to conduct explosive operations and render safe procedures with Demolition Remote and Time devices.  Expeditionary Radiographic Kits (ERK) is a Radiographic X-Ray machine that allows EOD technicians to determine the condition of a device / munition's without having to first gain physical access.  Grid Aim Kits, a grid overlay capability that ensures a high level of accuracy when targeting individual components inside an IED/WMD.  AN/PDX-2 calibration needed to conduct the calibrations of the Radica Set in order to maintain the equipment's ability to accurately measure radiation.  Small Unmanned Ground Vehicles-310 robots and Small Unmanned Ground Vehicles-110 robots that allow EOD Marines to investigate and conduct render safe procedures at a stand of distance.

FY 2019 Base Appropriation Request: $47.854M

FAMILY OF EOD EQUIPMENT: ($45.962M) Funding supports various tool kits and the following items:  Medium robots, robots that allow EOD Marines to investigate and conduct render safe procedures at a stand of distance. Video Inspection Capability (VIC) that consist of a video fiberscope that enables the inspection of contents and circuity of an IED in a small package with real time imagery. Kukri-Saber a diagnostic system designed to analyze an electrical detonator or switch within an IED firing circuity and monitors the electrical current in a single wire conductor designed to electronically isolate that conductor should the electronic current rise above a preset threshold.  Mini-Mira, a system that detects active microwave, ultrasonic, and infrared signatures emitting from an IED or WMD device.  Expeditionary Radiographic Imaging Systems, a Radiographic X-Ray machine that allows EOD technicians to determine the condition of a device/munition without having to first gain physical access. Remote Fuze Disassembly kits, an EOD system that allows the EOD Marine to inert live ammunitions.  Bomb Suit Tool kit which include Chemical, Biological, Nuclear, Radiological and Explosive (CBNRE) kits. Search kits which provides EOD Marines with specialized tools and equipment to perform interior and exterior search operation involving IED. Tec kits, SL-3 kits, X-Ray GO kits and IED Kits which provide the EOD Marine with the necessary tools and equipment to support render safe procedures and operations involving IED and WMDs. Table of Equipment Plus Up which supports the growth of two USMC platoons, Sensor Detectors, and Improvised Explosive Device (IED)/Weapons of Mass Destruction (WMD) diagnostic kits.  Advanced Manufacturing (AVM):  AVM allows for manufacturing of hard to procure pieces and parts.  It allows specialized tool fabrication, flattens the supply chain, and shortens the wait time for EOD to diagnose and render safe improvised explosive devices.  Capabilities consists of AVM machines, associated hardware, software, training, technical manual development, 3 dimensional scanning, controllers, internal networks, and communication assets. The IED WMD is a capability that will allow the EOD Marine to have the ability to detect radiation, conduct field confirmatory chemical analysis, conduct Thru-Barrier Chemical detection, handheld colorimetric chemical detection, biological sampling, the ability to communicate and report back findings,  conduct personal decontamination and have the ability to protect the EOD Marine from hazardous effects of those materials. 

FAMILY OF COUNTER-IMPROVISED EXPLOSIVE DEVICE (C-IED) CAPABILITIES (F2C): ($1.891M) Funding supports procurement of Counter Improvised Explosive Device (C-IED) Capability (F2C) equipment. This procurement provides critical equipment such as Sickle Sticks; a long pole used to positively identify in placed explosive hazard and other F2C tools to detect and mark explosive hazards; provide standoff and remote-controlled detection and marking and remove operating forces from direct contact with explosive hazards.  

ASSAULT BREACHER VEHICLE MODIFICATION: ($0.001M) Funding supports ABV Lift Motor modernization efforts.
  
FY 2020 Base Appropriation Request: $44.700M 

FAMILY OF EOD EQUIPMENT: ($43.360M) Funding will be used to procure the following:  Supply Stock Lists (SL-3), equipment to include Counter-Weapons of Mass Destruction kits.  Mini-Mira, a system that detects active microwave, ultrasonic, and infrared signatures emitting from an IED or WMD device.  Medium robots, robots that allow EOD Marines to investigate and conduct render safe procedures at a stand of distance.  Remote Fuze Disassembly kits, an EOD system that allows the EOD Marine to inert live ammunitions.  These modifications will allow the service life extension of the system.  AN/PVS-31 Optic Sight sustainment will allow the Marine Corps the ability to maintain and fix broken systems. Decrease of $2.602M from FY19 to FY20 is due to completion of Medium robot procurement.

ASSAULT BREACHER VEHICLE MODIFICATION:  ($1.340M) Funding will continue to support ABV Lift Motor modernization efforts and initiate upgrades to mine plows allowing ABV sea to land loading and unloading, Field Service Representative (FSR) support, update Tech Manuals (TM) , and Information Assurance (IA) support. Increase of $1.339M from FY19 to FY20 reflects realignment from Engineer Modification Kits (EMK) BLI 6670 supporting upgrades to mine plows, FSR support, TM updates and IA support.

OCO: 
FY 2018 Overseas Contingency Operations (OCO) Request: $20.777M ($4.000M MRAP, $16.777M EOD)

MINE RESISTANT AMBUSH PROTECTED (MRAP) Family of Vehicles (FoV): $4.000M Funded the installation of Egress kits procured in response to MARCENT enduring requirements.  The Egress kit increased force protection on all Cougar CAT I and CAT II variants by ensuring that vehicle occupants can safely exit the vehicle after blast, rollover or water submersion events.

FAMILY OF EOD EQUIPMENT: ($16.777M) - Procures Commercial Off the Shelf (COTS) equipment to include sensor detectors, video fiber optic scopes, Improvised Explosive Devices (IED)/Weapons of Mass Destruction (WMD) diagnostic kits and fusion optics.  These capabilities will give the EOD technician precision capabilities to counter IEDs/WMDs during category "A" incidents where the EOD technician is required to assume a grave and immediate risk and physically operate within the very serious injury zone.  Continue to provide support to EOD operations currently in support of U.S. Forces Central Command (CENT) and other "NEW NORM" (ONN) Special Purpose Marine Air Ground Task Forces (SPMAGTFs) Crisis Response (CR) postured world-wide require a multitude of EOD specific equipment items to achieve full readiness, enabling supported units and nations engaged against the threat and use of IEDs, WMDs, and Unexploded Explosive Ordnance (UXO).

FY 2019 Overseas Contingency Operations (OCO) Request: $8.000M

FAMILY OF COUNTER-IMPROVISED EXPLOSIVE DEVICE (C-IED) CAPABILITIES (F2C): ($8.000M) Procures Husky Mounted Detection System Wire Detection (HMDS-WD) systems in support of R2C FoS Increment II Capabilities.  This capability will yield faster, more effective route clearance missions, significantly improve chances of avoiding an explosive hazard strike, and better awareness of the enemy's tactics, techniques, and procedures.  The current HMDS lacks the ability to find command wires associated with deeply buried IEDs, relying on the ground penetrating radar to find the IED main charge or container.

FY 2020 Overseas Contingency Operations (OCO) Request: $3.670M.  

FAMILY OF COUNTER-IMPROVISED EXPLOSIVE DEVICE (C-IED) CAPABILITIES (F2C): ($3.670M) Procures hand-held buried wire detection devices while dismounted, to include sweeping suspected IED locations during dismounted operations.  The outer portions of the hand-held buried wire detection device employs this capability as part of their mission to locate command wire.

Name.@footnote: ABV FY20 increase of $1.339M reflects realignment from EMK BLI 6670 supporting upgrades to mine plows, FSR sustainment support, TM updates and IA support through Toughbook procurement and refresh

FY20 will procure items such as; Supply Stock Lists (SL-3) equipment to include Counter-Weapons of Mass Destruction kits, Man Transportable Robotic System, Remote Fuze Disassembly kits, and Mini-Mira (active microwave, ultrasonic, and infrared detector). EOD tool kits include Chemical, Biological, Nuclear, Radiological and Explosive kits, Search kits, Tech kits, Tool kits, SL3 kits, X-Ray GO kits, and IED kits. FY19 will procure items such as; sensor detectors, video fiber optic scopes, Improvised Explosive Devices (IED)/Weapons of Mass Destruction (WMD) diagnostic kits and fusion optics.
